list_definition.definition: great in extent, especially from side to side

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Her eyes were wide with surprise.

list_definition.definition: being a certain distance from one side to the other

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: This material is three metres wide
He won by a wide margin.

list_definition.definition: covering a large and varied range of subjects etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She has a wide experience of teaching.

list_definition.definition: with a great distance from top to bottom or side to side

list_ex_of_english: In these decades nonconformists were learning to speak not only to their own constituency but also to a wider public.
Verbs were chosen as the class of words to be used, mainly because they take the widest range of suffixes.
However, they also show that formulaic use may appear at the same time or even after wider use.
The wider scale of labour organisation and industrial action immeasurably complicated the jobber's task.
The text consists of discussion of a number of genres (or periods) of popular music discussed in a wider cultural context.
Against this background, the research focus was broadened to include wider political processes.
As the filters become more low pass, lateral inhibition becomes wider.
Likewise, discourse diversity enables speakers to have a wider and more detailed range of possible meanings and functions at their disposal.
